overview: The purpose of this measure is to establish a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the Second and Fifth Circuits. [6] The program is intended to acknowledge the distinct pathways that lead women into the criminal justice system and address their individualized needs. [6] The measure also requires the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to conduct an interim study to establish a blueprint for a women's court pilot program in the Third Circuit. [6]
appropriations: The committee report from the Committee on Finance does not specify any appropriation amounts. [6] While a previous committee report requested specific funding, your Committee on Finance is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, without inserting appropriation figures. [6] The bill is recommended to pass Third Reading with appropriations remaining unspecified. [6]
assumptions_and_methodology: The provided committee report does not contain any information on assumptions or methodology used for financial projections. [6] The report notes that the Committee received comments on this measure from the Judiciary and Department of Health, but does not detail any cost estimations. [6]
agency_impact: This measure will require the establishment of a women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the Second and Fifth Circuits. [6] It will also require the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to conduct an interim study. [6] The Judiciary and Department of Health provided comments on the measure, indicating their involvement. [6]
economic_impact: The committee report does not detail the economic impact of the measure. [6] The stated purpose is to address the individualized needs of women who are led into the criminal justice system through distinct pathways. [6] The program has received testimony in support from organizations including the Hawaii Substance Abuse Coalition and Community Alliance on Prisons. [6]
policy_impact: The measure establishes a three-year women's court pilot program in the Second and Fifth Circuits. [6] It also directs the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to conduct an interim study to establish a blueprint for a future pilot program. [6] The Committee on Finance is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, and recommends its passage. [6]
revenue_sources: The Committee on Finance report does not identify or discuss any revenue sources for this measure. [6] The funding mechanism remains as stated in the underlying bill. [6]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The provided committee report does not contain information on the six-year fiscal implications. [6] The measure establishes a three-year women's court pilot program in the Second and Fifth Circuits. [6] It also requires the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to conduct an interim study to establish a blueprint for a women's court pilot program, which will inform future costs. [6] The Committee on Finance is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, but does not specify any long-term funding. [6] The bill is recommended for Third Reading without detailed multi-year fiscal projections in this report. [6]
operating_revenue_impact: The provided legislative documents do not indicate any anticipated impact on operating revenues. [6]
capital_expenditure_impact: The provided legislative documents do not specify any capital expenditures. [6]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: This committee report does not address the fiscal implications after six years. [6] Any long-term financial obligations would be determined after the three-year pilot program concludes and the Third Circuit completes its interim study. [6]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The most significant update is that the Committee on Finance report on H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, does not include any specific appropriation amounts. [6] While a previous committee report requested specific appropriations for the Department of Health, this report from the Committee on Finance confirms its accord with the bill's intent and recommends that it pass Third Reading without inserting any funding figures. [6]
fte_positions: The current committee report does not contain any reference to the creation or funding of full-time equivalent positions. [6]
appropriations_changes: Appropriations in H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, remain unspecified. [6] The Committee on Finance did not act on a previous committee's request to insert a specific dollar amount. [6] The committee recommends that the bill pass Third Reading with its appropriation sections remaining blank. [6]
funding_sources_changes: The funding source for this measure has not changed. [6] The committee report does not propose any alternative funding sources to the general revenues identified in the bill. [6]
department_impact: The departments impacted by this measure remain the same. [6] The pilot program is to be established in the circuit court of the Second and Fifth Circuits, and a study is required of the Third Circuit of the Judiciary. [6] The Department of Health also remains involved, having submitted comments on the measure. [6]
reports_required: The reporting requirements have not changed in this version. [6] The measure still requires the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to conduct an interim study and develop a blueprint for a women's court pilot program. [6]
pilot_program: The pilot program's scope is unchanged. [6] The measure continues to establish a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the Second and Fifth Circuits. [6]
sunset_date: The sunset date for the pilot program has not been altered by this committee report. [6]
effective_date: The effective date for the bill has not been altered by this committee report. [6]
